User.description: Represents individual users within the ServiceNow platform, containing information like username, email, and roles.

Group.description: Represents a collection of users, used for assigning tasks, roles, and access controls.

Role.description: Defines the permissions and access levels for users within the ServiceNow platform.

Incident.description: Tracks incidents reported by users, including details like the description of the problem, the user who reported it, and the current status.

Problem.description: Records problems identified within the IT environment, aimed at root cause analysis and resolution to prevent future incidents.

Change Request.description: Manages changes to IT infrastructure and services, including risk assessment, approval workflows, and implementation details.

Service Request.description: Handles requests from users for various services, such as access to applications, new equipment, or other support.

Request Item.description: Represents individual items in a service request.

Catalog Task.description: Tracks tasks related to service catalog items.

Knowledge Article.description: Stores information in a structured format to help users find solutions to common issues or to learn about specific topics.

Configuration Item (CI).description: Represents assets or services that need to be managed to deliver IT services, including hardware, software, and network components.

Task.description: Generic table for tasks that need to be performed, used as a parent table for many other task-based tables like incidents and changes.

Asset.description: Manages the lifecycle of assets from procurement to retirement.

CMDB.description: Configuration Management Database, which stores information about configuration items (CIs) and their relationships.

Service Catalog Item.description: Represents individual items in the service catalog that users can request, such as hardware, software, or access to services.

Service Level Agreement (SLA).description: Defines the level of service expected from a service provider, including metrics like response and resolution times.

Business Rule.description: Server-side scripts that execute when records are displayed, inserted, updated, or deleted, used to enforce business logic.

Client Script.description: Client-side scripts that execute in the browser to enhance user interaction and ensure data integrity.

UI Policy.description: Client-side logic that changes the appearance and behavior of forms and fields dynamically.

UI Action.description: Adds buttons, links, and context menu items to forms and lists, enabling users to perform actions like saving or deleting records.

Workflow.description: Automates multi-step processes within the platform, defining the sequence of activities to be executed.

Script Include.description: Server-side reusable scripts that can be invoked from other server-side scripts.

Scheduled Job.description: Automates tasks that need to be performed on a regular schedule, like data imports or sending notifications.

Report.description: Provides a way to create and view reports based on data in the system, allowing for visualization and analysis.

Dashboard.description: Aggregates multiple reports and performance metrics into a single view, providing an overview of key data.

Metric.description: Tracks and measures performance metrics for various processes and services.

SLM.description: Service Level Management, used to manage SLAs, OLAs, and underpinning contracts.

Audit.description: Tracks changes to records and maintains an audit history.

Notification.description: Manages email notifications sent to users based on certain events or conditions.

Inbound Email Action.description: Processes incoming email and triggers actions within the platform.

Outbound Email.description: Records details of emails sent from the platform.

Integration.description: Manages integrations with external systems, including APIs and data import/export.

Attachment.description: Stores files attached to records within the platform.

REST Message.description: Defines outbound REST messages to integrate with external REST APIs.

SOAP Message.description: Defines outbound SOAP messages to integrate with external SOAP APIs.

Service Portal.description: Customizable web interface for users to interact with the ServiceNow platform.

Mobile App.description: Configuration for mobile applications to provide access to ServiceNow functionality on mobile devices.

Flow Designer.description: Tool for creating and managing workflows using a low-code, drag-and-drop interface.

Service Mapping.description: Maps IT services to the underlying infrastructure and applications supporting them.

Event Management.description: Monitors and manages events generated by IT infrastructure to identify and address issues.

Security Incident.description: Tracks and manages security incidents, including investigation and resolution.

Threat Intelligence.description: Aggregates and analyzes threat data to identify potential security risks.

Vulnerability.description: Manages the identification, assessment, and remediation of vulnerabilities in IT infrastructure.

GRC.description: Governance, Risk, and Compliance management, used to ensure regulatory compliance and manage risks.

Project.description: Manages projects, including tasks, resources, and timelines.

Time Card.description: Tracks time spent on various tasks and projects.

Idea.description: Captures and tracks ideas for improvement or innovation.

Demand.description: Manages demands for new services, products, or projects.

Cost Plan.description: Manages financial planning for projects and services.

Agile Story.description: Tracks user stories in Agile development processes.

Scrum Task.description: Tracks tasks in Scrum development processes.
